comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Marion Kennedy is likely the daughter of Mrs. H. Van Rensselaer Kennedy. See, for example, NYT of Jan 25, 1912 select.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F00616FC3C581373...

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Mrs. M. Belmont may be Mrs. Morgan Belmont. If so, she is the former Margaret Frances Andrews, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Paul A. Andrews. See engagement annoncement in NYT of April 25. 1915 select.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=FB0C1EFD3C5D1773... She is mentioned as tall and of light complexion -- which is compatible with the rightmost woman.

comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: Mrs. Morgan Belmont is correct. There is a photo of the three women in the New-York tribune, September 19, 1915, Page 9 under the title "UNITED HUNTS EVENTS DRAW SOCIETY TO BELMONT PARK TERMINAL", see chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn83030214/1915-09-19/ed-... See also The Sun, September 19, 1915, Page 7 (chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn83030272/1915-09-19/ed-...)

comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: The third woman then must be Violet Cushman Coddington (www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=18916772), the wife of Lt Commander Dave Hennen Coddington (www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=46913731).

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: The Sept 19 newspaper photos are clearly at the same event.  The women are in the same clothes.

comment.author: 35014516@N03
comment._content: swanq:  Thanks for unearthing the full names here.  We'll include some of your information next time we update.
